page.title: 08Social Concerns of Penn
page.content: Penn Common is a green belt of land on the edge of an urban area. The common is mainly a private golf course and isolated farms and houses can be found on the outside edge. There are many features situated on and around Penn Common. These include: 1. Penn Riding School 2. Tetherered animals on the common 3. Pub, "The Barley Mow" 4. Duck pound 5. Golf Course. Conflicts occur on this land because it one of the few open spaces in this urban area. These conflicts include: People trespassing on private land. Animals grazing on the golf course. People using the golf course for walking their dogs. Horses not using permitted tracks. Penn Common abused by motorists. However, the gives much pleasure.
